com.slightlyloony.blog.templates.functions

Class Function

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.slightlyloony.blog.templates.functions.Function
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Datum

    public class Function
extends java.lang.Object
implements Datum
    Generic template function container for all functions, supplying argument checking and interfacing. The actual computation bit of each template function is defined in FunctionDef.
    Author:
    Tom Dilatush tom@dilatush.com

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static Function create(FunctionDef _def,
                              Datum[] _args)
        Creates a new instance of this class, or returns null if there was a problem. See validate(FunctionDef, Datum[]) to get the details of why there was a problem.
        Parameters:
        _def - the function definition for the new instance
        _args - the arguments for the new instance

      • validate

        public static java.lang.String validate(FunctionDef _def,
                                        Datum[] _args)
        Checks the given function definition and arguments for validity. Returns null if there are no errors, or an explanatory string if there are.
        Parameters:
        _def - the function definition to be checked
        _args - the arguments to be checked
        Returns:
        null if there are no errors, or an explanatory string if there are
